captions.text:
Hey Vsauce, I'm Jake and in Minecraft you can make some pretty incredible things like
WesterosCraft which is about 501 square miles making

it larger than New York City and roughly the
same size as Los Angeles. The development

leads, Will Blew and Jacob Granberry, have
been working on the project for over 2 years

with the help of hundreds of volunteers, faithfully
rebuilding Westeros from Game of Thrones and
all of its major cities to scale.

But instead of 1bit of knowledge, this is
9bit.

In 1977 Atari released the Atari 2600 system
which at it's peak, had 80% of the video

game market. They also hold the title for
releasing what is considered one of the worst

video games ever made, ET the Extra Terrestrial.
In an act of crazy hubris, they made 5 million

copies of the game, and sold only 1.5 million
of them. Atari sent the remaining millions

of copies and other disasters to a landfill
in New Mexico, where everything was crushed,

buried and then covered in cement. If you
were to lay the ET game cartridges down flat

and stack the 3.5 million unsold copies on
top of one another it would be over 233,300

feet tall which is about 160 Empire State
Buildings high.

If you really want to play ET then you can
buy it and over 6,850 other games for the

low starting price of $575,000. Ebay seller,
videogame museum, is currently looking to

get rid of his collection that includes more
than 330 consoles, 220 controllers and spans

30 years of gaming history. To see everything
he is selling, you can look through this itemized
list that is a staggering 135 pages long.

One thing the collection lacks is Grand Theft
Auto: Saw by publisher Syrian Games who sells

ridiculously hacked and pirated copies of
popular video games. These games also have
the best cover art I've ever seen...

Artist Foxfoxwaltz creates amazing video game
inspired functional sculptures like this Last

Guardian Speaker enclosure and this incredible
Shadow of the Colossus external hard drive.

And for bonus points he even did a Cat Bus
enclosure.

If you're really a hardcore gamer, then
meet Okan Kaya who holds the Guinness Record

for longest video game marathon ever. Okan
played Call of Duty: Black Ops 2 for more
than 135 hours over 7 consecutive days. He could take 10 minute breaks every hour or skip them to
take longer breaks later so he could sleep.

But for musical dedication there's YouTuber
John Dreamer who composes fantastic scores

for his favorite video games like this epic
one for Assassin's Creed 3...

Grab your bud and hops on over to the first-ever
arcade that also dispenses beer. The beercade

is half fighting game half robot bartender
that serves you a cold one after your opponent
taps out.

For a more sober gaming experience, check
out this augmented reality puzzle game by

Julian Oliver. It uses solid plastic cubes
that have a different room on each face. Tilt

the cube in order to get the character to
go through doors that bring him to different

rooms. There are 3 levels in total, represented
by 3 separate cubes and you have to get him
to the exit of each one until he finally escapes.

Links to everything are in the description
below.
I'm Jake and, as always, thanks for watching.
